Member Of: N/auth Change current user's email
Member Of: N/auth Change current user's password
Member Of: N/cache Get a named, scoped cache.

Member Of: N/cache Get a value from the cache. If the key is not present, the loader will be called to generate the value which will
then be cached and returned. If the value returned by the loader is not a string, JSON.stringify() will be called
on the value before it is placed in the cache.
The maximum size for the cache key is 4kb and 500kb for the value returned by the loader.

Member Of: N/plugin Returns the script IDs of implementations of the given custom plugin type. If there's no custom plugin type

Member Of: N/cache Remove a value from the cache. If values in the cache were retrieved from a record, the associated cache keys
should be invalidated by a beforeSubmit UserEvent Script when the record is updated in order to prevent stale
values.

Member Of: N/cache Put a value into the cache. Note that "get" can be called with a loader as simpler alternative. If the value
is not a string, JSON.stringify() will be called on the value before it is placed in the cache.

Member Of: N/search Runs the current search.
Member Of: N/search Runs the current search with a paged interface.
Member Of: N/search Returns the object type name (search.Search)
Member Of: N/search JSON.stringify() implementation.
Member Of: N/search Returns the object type name (search.Filter)
Member Of: N/search JSON.stringify() implementation.

Member Of: N/search Returns the search column for which the minimal or maximal value should be found when returning the search.Column value.
For example, can be set to find the most recent or earliest date, or the largest or smallest amount for a record,
and then the search.Column value for that record is returned. Can only be used when summary type is MIN or MAX.
Member Of: N/search Returns the object type name (search.Column)
Member Of: N/search JSON.stringify() implementation.

Member Of: N/search Retrieve a slice of the search result set. Only 1000 results can be returned at a time. If there are fewer results
available than requested, then the array will be truncated.

Member Of: N/search Calls the developer-defined callback function for every result in this set. The result set processed by each() may have maximum 4000 rows.
The callback function has the following signature:
  boolean callback(result.Result result);
If the return value of the callback is false, the iteration over results is stopped, otherwise it continues.
Note that the work done in the context of the callback function counts towards the governance of the script that called it.
Member Of: N/search Returns the object type name (search.ResultSet)
Member Of: N/search JSON.stringify() implementation.

Member Of: N/search Returns the value of a specified search return column. The column may be specified in two ways:
1) by providing a search.Column object
2) by providing name, join and summary parameters

Member Of: N/search Returns the UI display name (i.e. the text value) of a specified search return column.
Note that this method is supported on select, image and document fields only.
The column may be specified in two ways:
1) by providing a search.Column object
2) by providing name, join and summary parameters
Member Of: N/search Returns the object type name (search.Result)
Member Of: N/search JSON.stringify() implementation.
Member Of: N/search undefined
Member Of: N/search undefined
Member Of: N/search undefined

Member Of: N/ui/serverWidget Use this method to manage redirects in an assistant. In most cases, an assistant redirects to itself
 The sendRedirect(response) method is like a wrapper method that performs this redirect. This method
 also addresses the case in which one assistant redirects to another assistant. In this scenario,
 the second assistant must return to the first assistant if the user Cancels or the user Finishes.
 This method, when used in the second assistant, ensures that the user is redirected back to the
 first assistant.

Member Of: N/xml Generate XML Document object from a string.
Member Of: N/xml Generate a String from an XML Document object.
Member Of: N/xml Returns an Array of Nodes matching the provided XPath expression.
Member Of: N/xml Adds the node newChild to the end of the list of children of this node. If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
Member Of: N/xml Returns a duplicate of this node, i.e., serves as a generic copy constructor for nodes. The duplicate node has no parent.

Member Of: N/xml Compares the reference node, i.e. the node on which this method is being called, with a node, i.e. the one passed as a parameter,
with regard to their position in the document and according to the document order.
Member Of: N/xml Returns whether this node (if it is an Element) has any attributes.
Member Of: N/xml Returns whether this node has any children.

Member Of: N/xml Inserts the node newChild before the existing child node refChild. If refChild is null, insert newChild at the end of the list of children.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
Member Of: N/xml This method checks if the specified namespaceURI is the default namespace or not.

Member Of: N/xml Tests whether two nodes are equal.
This method tests for equality of nodes, not sameness (i.e., whether the two nodes are references to the same object) which can be tested
with Node.isSameNode(). All nodes that are the same will also be equal, though the reverse may not be true.
Two nodes are equal if and only if the following conditions are satisfied:
- The two nodes are of the same type.
- The following string attributes are equal: nodeName, localName, namespaceURI, prefix, nodeValue
- The attributes maps are equal
- The childNodes lists are equal

Member Of: N/xml Returns whether this node is the same node as the given one.
This method provides a way to determine whether two Node references returned by the implementation reference the same object.
When two Node references are references to the same object, even if through a proxy, the references may be used completely interchangeably,
such that all attributes have the same values and calling the same DOM method on either reference always has exactly the same effect.
Member Of: N/xml Look up the namespace URI associated to the given prefix, starting from this node.
Member Of: N/xml Look up the prefix associated to the given namespace URI, starting from this node. The default namespace declarations are ignored by this method.

Member Of: N/xml Puts all Text nodes in the full depth of the sub-tree underneath this Node, including attribute nodes, into a "normal" form
where only structure (e.g., elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, and entity references) separates
Text nodes, i.e., there are neither adjacent Text nodes nor empty Text nodes.
Member Of: N/xml Removes the child node indicated by oldChild from the list of children, and returns it.

Member Of: N/xml Replaces the child node oldChild with newChild in the list of children, and returns the oldChild node.
If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.

Member Of: N/xml Attempts to adopt a node from another document to this document. If supported, it changes the ownerDocument
of the source node, its children, as well as the attached attribute nodes if there are any. If the source
node has a parent it is first removed from the child list of its parent.
Member Of: N/xml Creates an attribute node of the given name.
Member Of: N/xml Creates an attribute of the given qualified name and namespace URI.
Member Of: N/xml Creates a CDATASection node whose value is the specified string.
Member Of: N/xml Creates a Comment node given the specified string.
Member Of: N/xml Creates an empty DocumentFragment object.
Member Of: N/xml Creates an element of the type specified.
Member Of: N/xml Creates an element of the given qualified name and namespace URI.
Member Of: N/xml Creates a ProcessingInstruction node given the specified name and data strings.
Member Of: N/xml Creates a Text node given the specified string.
Member Of: N/xml Returns the Element that has an ID attribute with the given value. If no such element exists, this returns null.
Member Of: N/xml Returns an array of all the Elements with a given tag name in document order.
Member Of: N/xml Returns an array of all the Elements with a given local name and namespace URI in document order.

Member Of: N/xml Imports a node from another document to this document, without altering or removing the source node from the original document;
this method creates a new copy of the source node.
Member Of: N/xml Retrieves an attribute value by name.
Member Of: N/xml Retrieves an attribute node by name.
Member Of: N/xml Retrieves an attribute node by local name and namespace URI.
Member Of: N/xml Retrieves an attribute value by local name and namespace URI.
Member Of: N/xml Returns an array of all descendant Elements with a given tag name, in document order.
Member Of: N/xml Returns an array of all descendant Elements with a given local name and namespace URI in document order.
Member Of: N/xml Returns true when an attribute with a given name is specified on this element or has a default value, false otherwise.
Member Of: N/xml Returns true when an attribute with a given local name and namespace URI is specified on this element or has a default value, false otherwise.
Member Of: N/xml Removes an attribute by name.
Member Of: N/xml Removes the specified attribute node.
Member Of: N/xml Removes an attribute by local name and namespace URI.
Member Of: N/xml Adds a new attribute. If an attribute with that name is already present in the element, its value is changed to be that of the value parameter.
Member Of: N/xml Adds a new attribute node. If an attribute with that name is already present in the element, it is replaced by the new one.
Member Of: N/xml Adds a new attribute node. If an attribute with that local name and that namespace URI is already present in the element, it is replaced by the new one.

Member Of: N/xml Adds a new attribute. If an attribute with the same local name and namespace URI is already present on the element, its prefix is changed
to be the prefix part of the qualifiedName, and its value is changed to be the value parameter.

Member Of: N/search Creates a new search. The search can be modified and run as an ad-hoc search, without saving it. Alternatively,
calling Search.save() will save the search to the database, so it can be reused later in the UI or using search.load().

Member Of: N/search Loads an existing saved search. The saved search could have been created using the UI, or created using search.create()
in conjunction with Search.save().
Member Of: N/search Deletes an existing saved search.

Member Of: N/search Performs a search for duplicate records based on the account's Duplicate Detection configuration.
Note that this API only works for records that support duplicate record detection. These records include
customers, leads, prospects, contacts, partners, and vendors. Use either field or id parameter depending
on how you want to search for duplicates.
Member Of: N/search Performs a global search against a single keyword or multiple keywords.

Member Of: N/search Performs a search for one or more body fields on a record. This function supports joined-field lookups.
Note that the notation for joined fields is: join_id.field_name

Member Of: N/search Saves the current search as a saved search. Before calling save() the title property must be set. The optional
id property may also be set, if it's not then it's automatically generated. The title and id properties may be set:
1) upon creation (parameters title and id of the options object)
2) by explicitly setting the properties (e.g. Search.title = 'foo'; Search.id = 'customsearch_bar'; )
3) by loading a previously saved search (the properties are inherited)
Member Of: N/selectFieldOptions responsible for taking an options object and making a server request to retieve select field options data
